tasks.task: Navigate a tractor through a field planting crops} \\
subtasks: Enter the tractor cab and start the engine} \\
Adjust the seating position for comfort and safety} \\
Use the joystick or steering wheel to direct the tractor} \\
Engage the power take-off (PTO) and connect to planter} \\

tasks.task: Load the seed into the planter hopper} \\
subtasks: Locate the seed box on the planter unit} \\
Open the seed box access door and remove old seeds if necessary} \\
Measure and load the correct amount of seeds into the hopper} \\

tasks.task: Attach the planting implements to the tractor} \\
subtasks: Identify the appropriate attachment for planting (e.g., planter or drill)} \\
Position the attachment on the front of the tractor} \\
Secure the attachment using bolts or pins as needed} \\

tasks.task: Set up the planter for optimal seeding depth} \\
subtasks: Adjust the coulter depth to cut through residue and soil} \\
Position the seed furrow opener at the correct angle} \\
Ensure the closing wheels are properly aligned with the furrow} \\

tasks.task: Monitor row spacing during planting} \\
subtasks: Review the calibrations on the planter gauge wheels} \\
Check the spacing between planting units as they pass through the field} \\

tasks.task: Operate the planter to plant seeds at appropriate speed} \\
subtasks: Set the throttle to a steady planting speed} \\
Keep hands on the controls and eyes on the field for proper alignment} \\

tasks.task: Apply fertilizer via the tractor's fertilizer applicator} \\
subtasks: Confirm the type of fertilizer needed for the crop being planted} \\
Open the fertilizer container and connect tubing to the applicator} \\
Adjust the flow rate of fertilizer as it is dispersed behind the planter} \\

tasks.task: Ensure even distribution of fertilizer in the soil} \\
subtasks: Monitor the pattern of fertilizer being applied behind the planter} \\
Make adjustments to the applicator settings if clumps or uneven coverage are observed} \\

tasks.task: Oversee the planting operation to prevent seed from sticking} \\
subtasks: Regularly inspect the planter's seed tubes for blockages} \\
Clear blockages by hand using tools when necessary} \\

tasks.task: Similarly, the task of measuring and loading seeds into the hopper would be a separate MAINTASK.
Navigate a tractor through a field planting crops
subtasks: Enter the tractor cab and start the engine
Adjust the seating position for comfort and safety
Use the joystick or steering wheel to direct the tractor (including steering and PTO activation)
Engage the power take-off (PTO) and connect to the planter
Attach the planting implements to the tractor (planter/ drill)
Set up the planter for optimal seeding depth (adjust coulter, opener angle, closing wheels alignment)
Load the seed into the planter hopper

tasks.task: Monitor row spacing during planting
subtasks: Check and adjust the calibrations on the planter gauge wheels
Verify spacing between planting units as they pass through the field

tasks.task: Operate the planter to plant seeds at appropriate speed
subtasks: Set the throttle or speed control appropriately
Keep hands on the controls and visually check the alignment

tasks.task: Apply fertilizer via the tractor's fertilizer applicator
subtasks: Confirm the correct fertilizer type needed
Connect the applicator to the fertilizer container
Adjust the flow rate of fertilizer being applied

tasks.task: Ensure even distribution of fertilizer in the soil
subtasks: Monitor the applicator pattern behind the planter
Make adjustments if clumps or uneven coverage are detected

tasks.task: Oversee the planting operation to prevent seed from sticking
subtasks: Inspect seed tubes regularly for blockages
Clear any blockages manually using tools

Looking back, the MAINTASKs and SUBTASKs should cover all the physical actions involved in operating the tractor and planter as per the given transcript. I think the current list is comprehensive. The plan covers setting up the tractor, attaching the planter, preparing the planter, loading seeds, operating the planter, applying fertilizer, etc. All of these tasks are related to physically operating the machinery and ensuring everything runs smoothly during planting.
